threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] We can create a dedicated weekly digest page in our application and I'll send (post) a weekly newsletter manually to keep the scope of changes smaller

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] Lets review the proposed data model against what we have currently and consolidate the design into new clean data model moving forward. Okay to do breaking changes as long as we also update the frontend usage
threads.SectionPath: Briefly: GenAI News Aggregator Pipeline Design > Data Model

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] I don't think Anthropic has RSS here, we can remove RSS link here and I'll probably add articles by manual URL

Replies.Author: rcliao
Replies.Text: Potentially, we can utilize RSSHub like https://rsshub.app/anthropic/news

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] Meta also does not seem to have RSS at the moment. We can remove/replace by RSShub: https://rsshub.app/meta/ai/blog

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] Lets extend this daily to also fetch articles from manual URL (if submitted in previous day) as well

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] Given we use Go in this project, lets discard or change the following example code from python to go for better example
threads.SectionPath: Hacker News via API (not RSS) > Pipeline Workflow > Detailed Step Breakdown

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] Instead of hardcoding the SQL to look for 24 hours within, lets ensure interval here is configurable by input so I can run daily (24 hours) or weekly (7 days)

threads.Author: rcliao
threads.Text: [S] I want to make sure the digest pipeline creates a credible and short summary respecting our users time as design goal
